00006 #ifndef SEQ_H
00007 #define SEQ_H
00008 
00009 #include "config.h"
00010 
00011 typedef struct
00012 {
00013     /* Pointer to start of string.  */
00014     const char *str;
00015     /* Pointer to current position in string.  */    
00016     const char *cur;
00017     const char *(*callback) (void *data, const char *str);
00018     void *callback_data;
00019 } seq_obj_t;
00020 
00021 
00022 typedef seq_obj_t *seq_t;
00023 
00024 
00025 /* Note the callback function can be called with a NULL pointer if
00026    seq_set has not been called before seq_update.  When the end of
00027    string is reached the sequencer does not automatically go back to
00028    the start of the string.  The callback function can call seq_get
00029    and return the initial string to repeat the sequence.
00030 
00031    The callback can return the address of a string (this must be
00032    statically allocated) and the sequencer will use the new string.
00033    However, when the end of string is reached, the sequencer will
00034    start with the old string.  */
00035 
00036 
00037 /* Create a new sequencer with specified callback function and
00038    callback data.  */
00039 extern seq_t seq_init (seq_obj_t *dev, 
00040                        const char * (*callback) (void *data, const char *str),
00041                        void *callback_data);
00042 
00043 
00044 /* Set a new sequence.  */
00045 static inline void
00046 seq_set (seq_t seq, const char *str)
00047 {
00048     seq->str = str;
00049     seq->cur = str;
00050 }
00051 
00052 
00053 /* Return start of current sequence.  */
00054 static inline const char *
00055 seq_get (seq_t seq)
00056 {
00057     return seq->str;
00058 }
00059 
00060 
00061 /* Step to next element in sequence (note this depends on the callback
00062    function).  Returns non-zero at end of sequence.  */
00063 extern int8_t seq_update (seq_t seq);
00064 
00065 #endif
